author: Paul Berger
title: Harness May Have Cut Off Fuel, Causing New York Helicopter Crash
text:
The pilot of a helicopter that crashed in New York’s East River earlier this month told investigators that he spotted a portion of a passenger’s harness underneath a fuel-cutoff switch shortly before the accident that killed all five passengers.
Richard Vance, the pilot and lone survivor, told investigators with the National Transportation Safety Board that he was flying along the eastern side of Central Park on the evening of March 11 when the front passenger slid across a double bench seat to take a photograph of his feet...
